name: Shivaleela Uppula
title: Senior Data Center & Network Engineer
professional_summary: I am having 10 years of experience in designing, deploying, and troubleshooting complex multi-tenant, multi-data-center network architectures using technologies such as MPLS, VXLAN, and EVPN for high-stakes healthcare data environments, ensuring strict HIPAA compliance across all layers.

Deploying advanced BGP routing protocols to optimize network performance and achieve sub-second fast convergence for critical healthcare applications, significantly enhancing the reliability of patient data exchange systems and real-time monitoring tools within a secure AWS cloud infrastructure.

Implementing comprehensive OSPF and EIGRP routing strategies to manage internal healthcare network segmentation, which improved traffic flow for electronic health record systems and medical imaging data transfers between geographically dispersed data centers.

Architecting and automating network security deployments using Python and Ansible to generate compliant configurations, enforce HIPAA security standards, and automate change management processes for thousands of network devices across Medline's supply chain.

Developing Python scripts with Jinja2 templates to automate the provisioning of secure VXLAN overlays, enabling scalable multi-tenant isolation for different hospital clients and internal departments while maintaining strict data sovereignty and privacy controls.

Orchestrating the migration of legacy healthcare network infrastructure to a modern SD-WAN solution, providing scalable and flexible connectivity for remote clinics and improving bandwidth for telehealth services while ensuring continuous DDoS mitigation.

Engineering a robust EVPN control plane to simplify the management of broadcast, unknown unicast, and multicast traffic across multi-data-center fabrics, directly supporting high-availability requirements for life-critical healthcare IoT devices and monitoring systems.

Leading the design of a PCI DSS-compliant network segment for handling financial transactions within healthcare billing systems, integrating secure edge controls and internet peering management to protect sensitive patient payment information.

Collaborating with security teams to establish DDoS mitigation protocols and secure internet peering points, safeguarding external-facing healthcare portals and APIs from volumetric attacks and ensuring uninterrupted access to patient services.

Utilizing NFV principles to virtualize network functions like firewalls and load balancers on AWS, increasing deployment agility for new healthcare applications and reducing the physical footprint in constrained hospital data center spaces.

Configuring cloud peering connections between AWS VPCs and on-premise healthcare data centers to create a hybrid environment, facilitating secure data lake ingestion for analytics while adhering to data residency regulations.

Diagnosing complex network issues in multi-vendor environments, leveraging deep packet inspection and flow analysis to resolve latency spikes affecting real-time radiology image streaming and surgical support systems.

Spearheading the adoption of Infrastructure as Code practices for network management, using Ansible playbooks to ensure configuration consistency and compliance across all healthcare network tiers, from access to core layers.

Designing and implementing network access control policies aligned with the principle of least privilege, segmenting medical device networks from general IT traffic to meet stringent FDA cybersecurity guidelines for connected health devices.

Optimizing MPLS Layer 3 VPN services to connect disparate healthcare facilities, providing secure and reliable transport for voice, video, and data while maintaining clear separation for different trust zones and clinical workflows.

Managing the full lifecycle of network hardware and software, from capacity planning and proof-of-concept testing in lab environments to production deployment and ongoing support for 24/7 healthcare operations.

Conducting regular network performance audits and compliance checks using automated Python tools, identifying configuration drift and proactively remediating vulnerabilities before they could impact clinical operations or audit outcomes.

Mentoring junior engineers on healthcare networking best practices, troubleshooting methodologies, and the importance of designing for high availability and disaster recovery in environments where network downtime can directly impact patient care.
